ETYMOLOGY: From English 'eye' + 'witness'. First attested in the early 17th century.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who has personally seen something happen and can give a first-hand account of it, typically in a court of law or to investigators.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 亲眼目睹某事发生并能提供第一手证词的人，通常指在法庭上或向调查人员提供证词的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The police are appealing for any eyewitnesses to the robbery to come forward.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 警方正在呼吁任何抢劫案的目击者站出来。
